job_title: Nurse Practitioner in Point Pleasant, WV
cons: Over worked, under paid, under appreciated, unsafe practice/work conditions, no work life balance

pros: Many dedicated staff members committed to patient's & organizational well-being. Good benefits, competitive salaries & benefits.
cons:
Management is very "old school" and non-progressive. Many leaders have limited education or other outside organizational experiences. Many have risen through the ranks without the skill sets, experience, or advanced education necessary to achieve departmental/organizational strengths. Consequently, they are unable to meet the demands of healthcare innovation.

In addition, Pleasant Valley Hosp (PVH) leadership lacks the ability to think and act collaboratively or creatively. Many are easily threatened by innovation, and undermine new suggestions, research, & progressive analysis. It is very "old boy's club" If PVH wants to align with Dignity Health's quest in rebranding itself as the epitome of human kindness--it needs to start with the leadership. This doesn't mean babying the staff/nurses/community physicians--it means holding these professionals accountable to a higher level of standards, behaviors, & professionalism. 

Both PVH & St John's Oxnard also lack a strong ethics committee. Nurses are not encouraged to reach out to an IRB for inappropriate/futile medical management/treatments. Families are allowed to dictate their wishes without the skilled conversations by medical staff  explaining how their agenda can prolong pain and suffering to the patient. It seems that these campuses are stuck in the way healthcare was practiced in the 1980s.
